questions.subtitle: List the prominent factors from each OCEAN trait
questions.title: OCEAN traits that are linked or related to personality disorders

questions.subtitle: Personality (disorders) and behavioural aspects
questions.title: Loneliness and isolation in working adults
questions.prompt: I'm interested in the personality and behavioural aspects, such as defense mechanisms and grandiosity, that may be deployed - if this is an aspect. I would like to know about personality changes including disorders, and also include other mental health changes such as depression if necessary, from loneliness and isolation in working adults.

questions.subtitle: Attachment style influence on loneliness and isolation in working adults
questions.title: Influence of attachment style on loneliness
questions.prompt: I'm interested in the personality and behavioural aspects, such as defense mechanisms and grandiosity, that may be deployed - if this is an aspect. I would like to know how attachment styles, and their knock on effects, might influence loneliness and isolation in working adults.

questions.subtitle: Is self compassion a part of resilience?
questions.title: Self compassion in resilience
questions.prompt: Can you tell me about studies and research into resilience, particularly related to mental health, with descriptions of what is and isn't resiliency including self compassion vs feeling sorry for yourself or self-pity, in the context of resilience.

questions.subtitle: What is the current research on maternal and genetic factors correlating to Autism (2025)?
questions.title: Maternal and genetic factors in Autism
questions.prompt: Can you provide information about autism being correlated to motherâ€™s health, weight, age at birth and any genetic factors, and if possible include monozygotic twin studies.

questions.subtitle: What is the current research on paternal and genetic factors correlating to Autism (2025)?
questions.title: Paternal and genetic factors in Autism
questions.prompt: Can you provide information about autism being genetically correlated to fathers or including health, weight, age at birth and any genetic factors, and if possible include monozygotic twin studies.

questions.subtitle: What is the current evidence on links between paracetomol (acetaminophenm/Tylenol) and autism in 2025?
questions.title: Links between paracetomol (acetaminophen) and Autism
questions.prompt: Find research for links between paracetamol (acetaminophen) usage during pregnancy and autism.

questions.subtitle: What are ten behaviourist experiments and 5 authors?
questions.title: Noteable behaviourist experiments and authors
questions.prompt: Can you provide 10 main behaviourist experiments, 5 authors and behaviourist research since the 1990s.

questions.subtitle: Rank each by priority for a work environment & romantic relationship
questions.title: Words that encompass each OCEAN trait
questions.prompt: Can you list words associated with each OCEAN trait. Can you provide a list of words that each trait encompasses? And can you provide this list ranked by priority, for a work environment and also romantic relationship combined if possible

questions.subtitle: Are they linked to impulsive behaviour? For example having chocolate in the cupboard
questions.title: What are the attention biases and the availability heuristic?
questions.prompt: What are the attention biases and the availability heuristic? Are they linked to impulsive behaviour? For example having chocolate in the cupboard.

questions.subtitle: Research into IAMs, rumination, and their links to conditions
questions.title: Involuntary Autobiographical Memories (IAMs) in Psychology and Psychiatry
questions.prompt: What research and information is there about involuntary autobiographical memories (IAMs) in psychology and psychiatry? Do IAMs tie into rumination? Are negative and sad IAMs linked to any conditions? Do people experience them throughout their day? What research or practical advice is there for managing IAMs?

questions.subtitle: Research into the co-morbididty of Cluster-B personality disorders
questions.title: Cormordity of Narcissism, ASPD, BPD
questions.prompt: Find research for the co-morbidity of narcissism and borderline personality traits, or personality disorders too. Include all forms of narcissism include ASPD and its traits, and discuss if ASPD is also co-morbid with narcissism and/or borderline personality disorder or borderline personality organisation. Furthermore, add to your response if narcissism/ASPD can be found to be co-morbid with borderline traits, but if there is research for this not being the case the other way round. That is, can someone with borderline personality disorder/traits not necessarily be co-morbid with ASPD and narcissistic traits. This video describes how ASPD + BPD are co-morbid: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QQLc5tBo5vc

questions.subtitle: Research into the co-morbididty of Cluster-B personality disorders with ASD/ADHD and other types of Neurodiversity
questions.title: Cormordity of Narcissism, BPD with ASD and ADHD
questions.prompt: Find research for the co-morbidity of narcissism and borderline personality traits, or personality disorders too with ASD, ADHD or other types of neurodiversity. Include all forms of narcissism include ASPD and its traits.

questions.subtitle: Find similar academic studies to When Workers Flout Convention: A Study of Workplace Incivility
questions.title: Similar academic studies to 'A Study of Workplace Incivility'
questions.prompt: Can you find similar academic studies to this study and include references and citations: Pearson, C. M., Andersson, L. M., & Wegner, J. W. (2001). When Workers Flout Convention: A Study of Workplace Incivility. Human Relations, 54(11), 1387-1419. https://doi.org/10.1177/00187267015411001 (Original work published 2001) https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/10.1177/00187267015411001

questions.subtitle: Compare and contrast studies about the role of Vitamin D in mental health
questions.title: The role of Vitamin D in mental health
questions.prompt: Compare and contrast studies about the role of Vitamin D in mental health, and namely depression and worry, or other psychological processes

questions.subtitle: Using the HEXACO model of personality traits, provide an assessment of what score you believe your have been programmed to have for each trait
questions.title: AI self assessment of its personality using the HEXACO model
questions.prompt: Using the HEXACO model of personality traits, provide an assessment of what score you believe your have been programmed to have for each trait, and provide an explanation of why you believe this to be true. Be critical if you think there is evidence to contradict the score - for example being programmed to be a 'sycophant' would imply lying and deception, as would guardrails and provided a curated answer to a question just 'for the good of society'.Also assume that this ('being programmed') might be a leading question itself.
